presenter.bio: Portal Hypertension and Gastric Varix Treatment by EUS

slide.title: Portal Hypertension and Gastric Varix Treatment by EUS
slide.titleNormalized: portal hypertension and gastric varix treatment by eus
slide.text:
Portal Hypertension and Gastric Varix Treatment by EUS Hongtan Chen, MD
The First Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang University, School of Medicine Hangzhou, China

slide.title: Portal Hypertension and Gastric Varix
slide.notes: Gastric varix are present in approximately 20% of patients with portal hypertension either in isolation or in combination with esophageal varix (EV). GV bleeds less frequently than EV. However, bleeding from GV tends to be more severe and lethal. Furthermore, endoscopic treatment for GV is more difficult and challenging..
slide.notesNormalized: gastric varix are present in approximately 20% of patients with portal hypertension either in isolation or in combination with esophageal varix (ev). gv bleeds less frequently than ev. however, bleeding from gv tends to be more severe and lethal. furthermore, endoscopic treatment for gv is more difficult and challenging..
slide.notesHtml:
Gastric varix are present in approximately 20% of patients with portal hypertension either in isolation or in combination with esophageal varix (EV).

GV bleeds less frequently than EV.

However, bleeding from GV tends to be more severe and lethal.

Furthermore, endoscopic treatment for GV is more difficult and challenging..
slide.text: Portal Hypertension and Gastric Varix Gastric varix（GV） are present in approximately 20% of patients with portal hypertension either in isolation or in combination with esophageal varix (EV). GV bleeds less frequently than EV. Bleeding from GV tends to be more severe and lethal. Endoscopic treatment for GV is difficult and challenging.

slide.title: Sarin Classification
slide.notes: Gastric varices are categorized into 4 types based on the relationship with EV, as well as by their location in the stomach: GOV type 1, GOV type 2, isolated gastric varix (IGV) type 1, and IGV type 2.
slide.notesNormalized: gastric varices are categorized into 4 types based on the relationship with ev, as well as by their location in the stomach: gov type 1, gov type 2, isolated gastric varix (igv) type 1, and igv type 2.
slide.notesHtml: Gastric varices are categorized into 4 types based on the relationship with EV, as well as by their location in the stomach: GOV type 1, GOV type 2, isolated gastric varix (IGV) type 1, and IGV type 2.
slide.text: Sarin Classification GVs are categorized into 4 types based on the relationship with EV, as well as by their location in the stomach: Gastroesophageal Varices (GOV) type 1, GOV type 2, isolated gastric varix (IGV) type 1, and IGV type 2. IGV1 IGV2

slide.title: IGV1
slide.notes: GOV type 1 is the most common type. The incidence of bleeding is highest with IGV type 1 followed by GOV type 2. And the venous drainage of IGV1 is different from GOV.
slide.notesNormalized: gov type 1 is the most common type. the incidence of bleeding is highest with igv type 1 followed by gov type 2. and the venous drainage of igv1 is different from gov.
slide.notesHtml: GOV type 1 is the most common type. The incidence of bleeding is highest with IGV type 1 followed by GOV type 2. And the venous drainage of IGV1 is different from GOV.
slide.text:
IGV1 GOV type 1 is the most common type. But, the incidence of bleeding is highest with IGV type 1 followed by GOV type 2.
And the venous drainage of IGV1 is different from GOV type1 and GOV type 2.

slide.title: Anatomic Classification System for Varices
slide.notes: When the pressure of portal vein is rising with varices, the direction of blood flow in portal vein and varices will change.
slide.notesNormalized: when the pressure of portal vein is rising with varices, the direction of blood flow in portal vein and varices will change.
slide.notesHtml: When the pressure of portal vein is rising with varices, the direction of blood flow in portal vein and varices will change.
slide.text: Anatomic Classification System for Varices When the pressure of portal vein is rising with varices, the direction of blood flow in portal vein and varices will change.

slide.title: Classification based on venous drainage
slide.notes: Due to these changes, several collateral shunts, including gastrocaval and gastrorenal shunt, commonly exist in IGV cases.
slide.notesNormalized: due to these changes, several collateral shunts, including gastrocaval and gastrorenal shunt, commonly exist in igv cases.
slide.notesHtml: Due to these changes, several collateral shunts, including gastrocaval and gastrorenal shunt, commonly exist in IGV cases.
slide.text: Classification based on venous drainage Type A has a shunt with a single draining vein. Type B has a shunt with multiple collateral draining veins. Type C has both a gastrocaval and gastrorenal shunt. Type D has multiple small draining veins and no shunt.

slide.title: Risk of EVO for IGV
slide.notes: Endoscopic Variceal Obturation (EVO) with tissue glue injection for bleeding GV is effective. While there is a high risk of pulmonary embolism for EVO in either gastrocaval or gastrorenal shunt cases.
slide.notesNormalized: endoscopic variceal obturation (evo) with tissue glue injection for bleeding gv is effective. while there is a high risk of pulmonary embolism for evo in either gastrocaval or gastrorenal shunt cases.
slide.notesHtml: Endoscopic Variceal Obturation (EVO) with tissue glue injection for bleeding GV is effective. While there is a high risk of pulmonary embolism for EVO in either gastrocaval or gastrorenal shunt cases.
slide.text: Risk of EVO for IGV Endoscopic Variceal Obturation (EVO) with tissue glue injection for bleeding GV is effective. While there is a high risk of pulmonary embolism for EVO in either gastrocaval or gastrorenal shunt cases. Clin Liver Dis 18 (2014) 809–827 Shiv K. Sarin, Awinash Kumar.

slide.notes: Balloon-occluded retrograde transvenous obliteration (BRTO) is the standard treatment for IGV in Japan. BRTO can occlude GVs while avoiding occurrence of pulmonary embolism.
slide.notesNormalized: balloon-occluded retrograde transvenous obliteration (brto) is the standard treatment for igv in japan. brto can occlude gvs while avoiding occurrence of pulmonary embolism.
slide.notesHtml: Balloon-occluded retrograde transvenous obliteration (BRTO) is the standard treatment for IGV in Japan. BRTO can occlude GVs while avoiding occurrence of pulmonary embolism.
slide.text: Balloon-occluded retrograde transvenous obliteration (BRTO) is the standard treatment for IGV in Japan. BRTO can occlude GVs while avoiding occurrence of pulmonary embolism. BRTO for IGV Shiv K. Sarin, Awinash Kumar. Clin Liver Dis 18 (2014) 809–827

slide.title: BRTO Assisted Endoscopic Glue Injection
slide.notes: BRTO assisted endoscopic glue injection can also avoid pulmonary embolism, but it requires interventional radiology and it is time consuming.
slide.notesNormalized: brto assisted endoscopic glue injection can also avoid pulmonary embolism, but it requires interventional radiology and it is time consuming.
slide.notesHtml: BRTO assisted endoscopic glue injection can also avoid pulmonary embolism, but it requires interventional radiology and it is time consuming.
slide.text: BRTO Assisted Endoscopic Glue Injection

slide.title: DMRTO
slide.notes: There is a substitute for BRTO called Dual Microcatheter Retrograde Transvenous Obliteration(DMRTO) with Coil Embolization.
slide.notesNormalized: there is a substitute for brto called dual microcatheter retrograde transvenous obliteration(dmrto) with coil embolization.
slide.notesHtml: There is a substitute for BRTO called Dual Microcatheter Retrograde Transvenous Obliteration(DMRTO) with Coil Embolization.
slide.text: DMRTO

slide.title: DMRTO
slide.notes: The function of coils in DMRTO is to catch and filter embolization material that will cause pulmonary embolism.
slide.notesNormalized: the function of coils in dmrto is to catch and filter embolization material that will cause pulmonary embolism.
slide.notesHtml: The function of coils in DMRTO is to catch and filter embolization material that will cause pulmonary embolism.
slide.text: DMRTO

slide.title: Structrue of Coil
slide.notes: Because glue immediately adheres to the coil fibers when a coil is immersed into blood of varix.
slide.notesNormalized: because glue immediately adheres to the coil fibers when a coil is immersed into blood of varix.
slide.notesHtml: Because glue immediately adheres to the coil fibers when a coil is immersed into blood of varix.
slide.text:
Structrue of Coil Glue immediately adheres to the coil fibers when a coil is immersed into blood of varix.
Surgical Endoscopy. 2016, Volume 30, 1396–1404

slide.title: EUS-guided Access for IGV1
slide.notes: The coils can be placed into varices via EUS guided approach. IGV1 is usually in the gastric fundus, so the punctrue needle would traverse the angle of His in order to reach the target from the lower esophagus.
slide.notesNormalized: the coils can be placed into varices via eus guided approach. igv1 is usually in the gastric fundus, so the punctrue needle would traverse the angle of his in order to reach the target from the lower esophagus.
slide.notesHtml: The coils can be placed into varices via EUS guided approach. IGV1 is usually in the gastric fundus, so the punctrue needle would traverse the angle of His in order to reach the target from the lower esophagus.
slide.text: Gastrointest. Endosc. 2013; 77: 846–857 EUS-guided Access for IGV1 The coils can be placed into varices via EUS guided approach. IGV1 is usually in the gastric fundus, so the punctrue needle would traverse the angle of His in order to reach the target from the lower esophagus.

slide.title: EUS-guided Access for GV
slide.notes: If the gastric varix is close to GE junction, punctrue needle can enter the target directly from the gastric mucosa.
slide.notesNormalized: if the gastric varix is close to ge junction, punctrue needle can enter the target directly from the gastric mucosa.
slide.notesHtml: If the gastric varix is close to GE junction, punctrue needle can enter the target directly from the gastric mucosa.
slide.text: EUS-guided Access for GV Scandinavian Journal of Gastroenterology. 2014; 49: 1136–1142 Gastrointest. Endosc. 2013; 77: 846–857

slide.title: EUS-guided Combined Coil and Glue Injection
slide.titleNormalized: eus-guided combined coil and glue injection
slide.notes: • Since the coil fibers act as a scaffold for glue, combining coil and glue injection for treatment of large GV is appealing as it could potentially decrease the risk of ectopic embolism and the volume of glue needed to achieve variceal obliteration.
slide.notesNormalized: • since the coil fibers act as a scaffold for glue, combining coil and glue injection for treatment of large gv is appealing as it could potentially decrease the risk of ectopic embolism and the volume of glue needed to achieve variceal obliteration.
slide.notesHtml: • Since the coil fibers act as a scaffold for glue, combining coil and glue injection for treatment of large GV is appealing as it could potentially decrease the risk of ectopic embolism and the volume of glue needed to achieve variceal obliteration.
slide.text: EUS-guided Combined Coil and Glue Injection Since the coil fibers act as a scaffold for glue, combining coil and glue injection for treatment of large GV is appealing as it could potentially decrease the risk of ectopic embolism and the volume of glue needed to achieve variceal obliteration.

slide.title: EUS-guided Combined Coil and Glue Injection
slide.titleNormalized: eus-guided combined coil and glue injection
slide.notes: This Video demonstrated the technique process: EUS needle enters the gastric varix, placing a coil with stylet as pusher into the varix, removing the stylet, injecting the glue, and then flushs needle with saline, now we can see the blood flow signal disappeared.
slide.notesNormalized: this video demonstrated the technique process: eus needle enters the gastric varix, placing a coil with stylet as pusher into the varix, removing the stylet, injecting the glue, and then flushs needle with saline, now we can see the blood flow signal disappeared.
slide.notesHtml:
This Video demonstrated the technique process:

EUS needle enters the gastric varix, placing a coil with stylet as pusher into the varix, removing the stylet, injecting the glue, and then flushs needle with saline, now we can see the blood flow signal disappeared.
slide.text: EUS-guided Combined Coil and Glue Injection EUS needle enters the gastric varix, placing a coil with stylet as pusher into the varix, removing the stylet, injecting the glue, and then flushs needle with saline, now we can see the blood flow signal disappeared.

slide.title: 2019 DDW Oral Presentation
slide.notes: Another role of EUS for GV treatment is Endoscopic Ultrasound Guided Selective Variceal Devascularization (EUS-SVD) for Secondary Prophylaxis of Variceal Bleeding from GOV.
slide.notesNormalized: another role of eus for gv treatment is endoscopic ultrasound guided selective variceal devascularization (eus-svd) for secondary prophylaxis of variceal bleeding from gov.
slide.notesHtml: Another role of EUS for GV treatment is Endoscopic Ultrasound Guided Selective Variceal Devascularization (EUS-SVD) for Secondary Prophylaxis of Variceal Bleeding from GOV.
slide.text: The Role of Endoscopic Ultrasound Guided Selective Variceal Devascularization (EUS-SVD) for Secondary Prophylaxis of Variceal Bleeding from Gastroesophageal Varices (GOV) 2019 DDW Oral Presentation

slide.title: Background
slide.notes: Patients who survive an episode of acute variceal bleeding of GOV have a very high risk of rebleeding. The key to prevent rebleeding is to obturate the perforating vessel feeding the varix. Endoscopic Variceal Obturation (EVO) with glue injection is performed with increasing frequency for the secondary prophylaxis. EVO is limited by the inability to locate the perforating vessel feeding the varix and difficulty to confirm the complete obturation of varices. Blind injection increases the risk of massive bleeding upon glue extrusion. The modified approach, EUS-SVD provides better visualization.
slide.notesNormalized: patients who survive an episode of acute variceal bleeding of gov have a very high risk of rebleeding. the key to prevent rebleeding is to obturate the perforating vessel feeding the varix. endoscopic variceal obturation (evo) with glue injection is performed with increasing frequency for the secondary prophylaxis. evo is limited by the inability to locate the perforating vessel feeding the varix and difficulty to confirm the complete obturation of varices. blind injection increases the risk of massive bleeding upon glue extrusion. the modified approach, eus-svd provides better visualization.
slide.notesHtml: Patients who survive an episode of acute variceal bleeding of GOV have a very high risk of rebleeding. The key to prevent rebleeding is to obturate the perforating vessel feeding the varix. Endoscopic Variceal Obturation (EVO) with glue injection is performed with increasing frequency for the secondary prophylaxis. EVO is limited by the inability to locate the perforating vessel feeding the varix and difficulty to confirm the complete obturation of varices. Blind injection increases the risk of massive bleeding upon glue extrusion. The modified approach, EUS-SVD provides better visualization.
slide.text: Patients who survive an episode of acute variceal bleeding of GOV have a very high risk of rebleeding. The key to prevent rebleeding is to obturate the perforating vessel feeding the varix. EVO with glue is performed with increasing frequency for the secondary prophylaxis of GOV. But it is limited by the inability to locate the perforating vessel feeding the varix and difficulty to confirm the complete obturation of varices. And blind injection increases the risk of massive bleeding upon glue extrusion. The modified approach, EUS-SVD provides better visualization. Background

slide.notes: For gastric varices greater than 5 mm, millimeter ，EUS guided needle puncture and injection therapy are not technically difficult. After the injection, hyperechoic filling and disappearance of the blood flow are observed.
slide.notesNormalized: for gastric varices greater than 5 mm, millimeter ，eus guided needle puncture and injection therapy are not technically difficult. after the injection, hyperechoic filling and disappearance of the blood flow are observed.
slide.notesHtml: For gastric varices greater than 5 mm, millimeter ，EUS guided needle puncture and injection therapy are not technically difficult. After the injection, hyperechoic filling and disappearance of the blood flow are observed.
slide.text: For gastric varices greater than 5 mm，EUS guided needle puncture and injection therapy are not technically difficult. After the injection, hyperechoic filling and disappearance of flow signal are observed.

slide.notes: Gastric varices smaller than 3 mm can be challenging for EUS guided puncture. Careful manipulation and adjustment of the tip of the needle is required.
slide.notesNormalized: gastric varices smaller than 3 mm can be challenging for eus guided puncture. careful manipulation and adjustment of the tip of the needle is required.
slide.notesHtml: Gastric varices smaller than 3 mm can be challenging for EUS guided puncture. Careful manipulation and adjustment of the tip of the needle is required.
slide.text: Gastric varices smaller than 3 mm can be challenging for EUS guided puncture. Careful manipulation and adjustment of the needle is required.

slide.title: Results
slide.notes: • In this two groups, massive bleeding rate is lower, injection sites are fewer, and amount of glue injected are less in the EUS-SVD group.
slide.notesNormalized: • in this two groups, massive bleeding rate is lower, injection sites are fewer, and amount of glue injected are less in the eus-svd group.
slide.notesHtml: • In this two groups, massive bleeding rate is lower, injection sites are fewer, and amount of glue injected are less in the EUS-SVD group.
slide.text: Results

slide.title: Results
slide.notes: Kaplan-Meier analysis showed a statistically significant lower risk of major rebleeding in EUS-SVD group with p value of 0.045.
slide.notesNormalized: kaplan-meier analysis showed a statistically significant lower risk of major rebleeding in eus-svd group with p value of 0.045.
slide.notesHtml: Kaplan-Meier analysis showed a statistically significant lower risk of major rebleeding in EUS-SVD group with p value of 0.045.
slide.text: Major bleed occurred in 1 out of 38 patients in the EUS-SVD group, compared to 5 out of 31 patients in EVO group, including 1 patient died from hemorrhagic shock. Kaplan-Meier estimate showed a lower risk of major bleeding in EUS-SVD group (p=0.045). Results

slide.title: Conclusions
slide.notes: To conclude this presentation,
slide.notesNormalized: to conclude this presentation,
slide.notesHtml: To conclude this presentation,
slide.text:
EUS-SVD provides better visualization and more precise delivery of glue into the varix and feeding vessel.
EUS-SVD may be a more effective and safer modality than standard EVO in secondary prophylaxis in GOV bleeding. Conclusions
